title: Calories in Potato Wedges
meta_description: Discover calories in potato wedges per serving, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition breakdown for baked or fried variations to help track your intake.
assumptions: Oven-baked from fresh russet potatoes, skin-on, lightly brushed with 1 tsp oil per 100g, seasoned with salt; typical side serving size.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by potato type, cooking method, oil amount, seasonings, and portion size. Check labels for frozen or restaurant versions.

quick_answer.text: A 150g serving of oven-baked potato wedges has about 225 kcal and 30g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp cheese topping per serving

faqs.q: How many calories in potato wedges per 100g?
faqs.a: About 150 kcal for oven-baked potato wedges per 100g.

faqs.q: Are potato wedges high in carbs?
faqs.a: Yes, around 20g carbs per 100g, mostly from starch.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in baked potato wedges?
faqs.a: Approximately 5g total fat per 100g, depending on oil used.
Yes, about 2.5g dietary fiber per 100g, thanks to the skin.

faqs.q: How do fried potato wedges compare calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Fried versions add 50+ kcal per 100g due to absorbed oil.
